questions.text: Can you describe a project you worked on that you're particularly proud of, and what was your role in its development?
How do you approach problem-solving in your coding projects, and can you give an example of a challenging problem you've overcome?

You've listed a range of technical skills, including C++, Python, and JavaScript. Can you tell me about a time when you had to learn a new programming language or technology, and how you went about doing so?

Your experience as a frontend developer at Bright-line Solutions suggests you have experience working with teams. Can you describe your experience with collaboration tools and version control systems like Git?

Your project, the AI-Powered Interviewer, involves natural language processing and machine learning. Can you explain the basics of how you're approaching this project, and what you hope to achieve with it?

As a final-year computer science undergraduate, you must have a good understanding of computer science fundamentals. Can you explain the trade-offs between monolithic architecture and microservices architecture in software development?
You've worked on several web-based projects, including the Study Group Management System and the E-learning System. How do you ensure the security and scalability of your web applications?

Your experience as an intern at WebDevrs and a trainee at the National Freelancing Training Program suggests you have experience working in different environments. Can you tell me about a time when you had to adapt to a new work environment or workflow, and how you handled it?
